items.name: Gig Flyer
items.description: A neon flyer for tonight's alternative showcase, proof that you're part of the scene.

items.name: Demo Tape
items.description: An unlabeled cassette buzzing with basement energy and tape hiss.

items.name: Backstage Pass
items.description: A laminated pass stamped with First Avenue's star. The undead bouncers respect it.

items.name: Setlist
items.description: Tonight's scrawled setlist, complete with notes about where the zombie choir joins in.

items.name: Guitar Pick
items.description: A worn neon pick that once shredded through a legendary solo.

items.name: Vinyl Record
items.description: A rare pressing of 'Zombie Minneapolis' by The Neon Dead.

rooms.name: Hennepin Avenue, 1982
rooms.entry_message: Purple neon hums over First Avenue as the undead crash the scene.

verbs.look: Flyers for Husker Du and The Suburbs flutter in the warm night.
verbs.talk: The paper rustles like a synth pad in the wind.
verbs.use: You peel back a fresh gig flyer from the stack.

hotspots.name: Record Store Door

verbs.look: Let It Be Records glows behind the glass with a violet OPEN sign.
verbs.use: You slip through the door into the record stacks.
verbs.talk: Through the glass you hear a drum machine rehearsing paradiddles.

hotspots.transition_message: The scent of vinyl and ozone wraps around you as you enter.

hotspots.name: Alley to KJRR

verbs.look: Graffiti arrows point toward KJRR's basement studio.
verbs.use: You jog down the alley toward the college radio bunker.
verbs.talk: Echoes answer from the brickwork in offbeat rhythms.

hotspots.transition_message: The hum of a basement transmitter fills your ears.

hotspots.name: First Avenue Door

verbs.look: A black doorway marked with a star labeled 'Artists'.
verbs.talk: "No pass, no stage," the bouncer groans melodically.
verbs.use: You press your palm against the cold steel door.
verbs.use_success: You flash the backstage pass; the zombie nods and shambles aside.
verbs.use_missing: The security zombie folds its arms. No pass, no entry.

hotspots.transition_message: Feedback and fog machines spill across the backstage.

verbs.look: Tonight: The Neon Dead with special guest Soul Asylum (undead mix).
verbs.talk: You pitch your own band name. The marquee winks in approval.

verbs.look: A flickering sodium lamp casts orange shadows on the sidewalk.
verbs.talk: The light hums an electronic drone in E minor.
verbs.use: You tap the pole; it flickers in response like a morse code message.

rooms.name: Let It Be Records
rooms.entry_message: Stacks of vinyl and undead crate-diggers nod along to unheard drum machines.

hotspots.name: Street Door

verbs.look: The avenue beckons beyond the glass.
verbs.use: You push back out to Hennepin Avenue.
verbs.talk: Outside, the muffled kick drum of the club keeps time.

hotspots.transition_message: The club's neon bleeds into the Minneapolis night.

verbs.look: A coffin-shaped listening booth thrums with low frequencies.
verbs.talk: The booth replies with a bone-rattling bass drop.
verbs.use: You imagine your own track blasting through these speakers.

verbs.look: A clerk polishes seven-inches with ritual precision.
verbs.talk: "Scene kids only," the clerk grins. "What have you got?"
verbs.use: You slide the gig flyer across the counter.
verbs.use_success: "Alright, you're legit." The clerk palms you an unlabeled demo tape.
verbs.use_missing: "Show me your flyer if you want in on the secret stash."

verbs.look: Fresh pressings gleam under the black light: Replacements, Prince, Suburbs.
verbs.talk: The records whisper track listings in your ear.
verbs.use: You flip through, letting the album art wash over you.

verbs.look: Behind glass: bootlegs, test pressings, and a rumored Prince demo.
verbs.talk: Legends murmur from these grooves.
verbs.use: The case is locked. The clerk guards this section jealously.

rooms.name: KJRR Basement Studio
rooms.entry_message: Posters peel from cinderblock walls as the ON AIR light flickers green.

hotspots.name: Alley Door

verbs.look: The alley back to First Avenue waits outside.
verbs.use: You head back toward the club.
verbs.talk: Someone carved band names into the door with a broken drumstick.

hotspots.transition_message: The throb of the main stage grows louder as you emerge.

verbs.look: A flickering ON AIR sign barely holds back the darkness.
verbs.talk: It buzzes in Morse code for 'play loud music'.
verbs.use: You tap the glass; it brightens to a toxic glow.

verbs.look: Stacks of cassettes teeter beside a flickering console.
verbs.talk: "Got anything raw for the airwaves?" the DJ rasps.
verbs.use: You offer up the demo tape.
verbs.use_success: The DJ slaps the tape into rotation and hands you a backstage pass.
verbs.use_missing: "Come back with something fresh," the DJ moans.

verbs.look: A rotary phone covered in stickers. The receiver dangles off the hook.
verbs.talk: You hear static and distant moaning. Someone's requesting 'Brains in the Night'.
verbs.use: You dial a request for the DJ. They nod approvingly.

verbs.look: Gig posters layer the wall: Husker Du, The Replacements, Prince.
verbs.talk: The posters rustle as if responding to your presence.
verbs.use: You carefully peel back a corner, but the poster crumbles to dust.

rooms.name: First Avenue Backstage
rooms.entry_message: Makeup mirrors blaze as The Neon Dead prep their instruments.

verbs.look: A crate of scribbled setlists sits beside the stage monitors.
verbs.talk: The papers flutter like a restless crowd.
verbs.use: You snag tonight's setlist as a souvenir.

verbs.look: An engineer zombie dials in the perfect wash of chorus and delay.
verbs.talk: The engineer hums a harmony only the undead can hear.
verbs.use: You tweak a knob and bathe the room in shimmering reverb.

hotspots.name: Stage Door

verbs.look: The door leads back to the alley.
verbs.use: You slip out toward the alley, ready to hype the scene.
verbs.talk: Distant cheers seep through the cracks.

hotspots.transition_message: You emerge into the Minnesota night, setlist in hand.

verbs.look: Bulbs blaze around mirrors reflecting pale faces and heavy eyeliner.
verbs.talk: Your reflection mouths 'Rock on' silently.
verbs.use: You apply some dramatic eyeliner. Stage-ready.

verbs.look: Battered cases stenciled with band names and tour dates.
verbs.talk: They creak with stories of a hundred venues.
verbs.use: You check for loose picks. You find one glowing neon green.

hotspots.name: Green Room Door

verbs.look: A door marked 'Green Room - Band Only'.
verbs.use: You push through into the green room.
verbs.talk: You hear muffled vocal warmups from inside.

hotspots.transition_message: The smell of cigarettes and hairspray fills your nostrils.

rooms.name: The Green Room
rooms.entry_message: Band members tune up while roadies carry cables and coffee.

hotspots.name: Backstage Door

verbs.look: The door back to the main backstage area.
verbs.use: You head back to the backstage.
verbs.talk: Stage sounds leak through the crack.

hotspots.transition_message: You return to the bustling backstage area.

verbs.look: A worn leather couch that's seen countless pre-show jitters.
verbs.talk: The cushions wheeze with decades of rock history.
verbs.use: You sink into the couch for a moment of calm before the storm.

verbs.look: Cold cuts and cheese. The rider demands have been met.
verbs.talk: The bologna whispers secrets of contract negotiations.
verbs.use: You grab a bite. Touring fuel.

verbs.look: Signed posters from every act that's graced this stage.
verbs.talk: Each signature tells a story of rock and roll survival.
verbs.use: You trace your finger over Prince's autograph. Magical.

verbs.look: Guitars gleam under the dim lights: a Les Paul, a Rickenbacker, a custom Flying V.
verbs.talk: They hum with potential energy, ready to scream.
verbs.use: You strum a chord. The room vibrates with anticipation.

verbs.look: A crate of vinyl, mostly local bands and rare imports.
verbs.talk: The records spin tales of Minneapolis music history.
verbs.use: You flip through and find a pristine copy of 'Zombie Minneapolis'.

verbs.look: Maya tunes her bass, half her face human, half transformed. The veins on her zombie arm pulse with eerie light.
verbs.talk: "I can still feel the music," she says, her voice shifting between human and otherworldly. "Even like this."
verbs.use: You offer her a guitar pick. She takes it with her human hand, tears forming in her one human eye.

verbs.look: A dignified zombie in a vintage 1950s suit adjusts his sunglasses. An unlit cigarette dangles from his lips.
verbs.talk: "Death is merely a key change, friend," Johnny muses philosophically. "The song goes on."
verbs.use: You try to light his cigarette. He waves you off. "Don't need to breathe anymore. Just keeping up appearances."

rooms.name: The Practice Space
rooms.entry_message: Foam walls muffle the echo of a hundred forgotten rehearsals.

verbs.look: A weathered drum set surrounded by cymbal stands and cigarette burns.
verbs.talk: The drums whisper stories of late-night jams and broken sticks.
verbs.use: You tap out a rhythm. The kit still has it.

verbs.look: A Marshall stack towers over a bass amp, knobs set to 11.
verbs.talk: The amps hum with potential energy, hungry for power chords.
verbs.use: You crank the gain. Feedback screams through the foam walls.

verbs.look: A sagging couch leaking stuffing, veteran of countless band arguments.
verbs.talk: The cushions remember every creative breakthrough and breakup.
verbs.use: You sink into the worn leather. Feels like home.

verbs.look: A handwritten setlist taped to the egg crate foam: your old band's songs.
verbs.talk: The setlist reads like a diary of dreams you used to have.
verbs.use: You trace the song titles with your finger. Almost makes you want to play again.

verbs.look: Two boom stands with mics positioned for harmonies that never quite happened.
verbs.talk: The mics wait patiently for voices that moved on long ago.
verbs.use: You test the mic. 'Check, check.' Still works.

hotspots.name: Warehouse Door

verbs.look: A dented metal door leading back to the venue.
verbs.use: You step through, leaving the practice space silent once more.
verbs.talk: The door has absorbed a thousand slams from frustrated musicians.

hotspots.transition_message: The echo of your footsteps fades behind you.

rooms.name: The Club Bathroom
rooms.entry_message: Flickering fluorescents illuminate graffiti confessions and cracked mirrors.

verbs.look: Your reflection fractures across spider-web cracks. Still you.
verbs.talk: The mirror shows you truth: bruised, brilliant, and unbreakable.
verbs.use: You fix your hair. Stage-ready, even in apocalypse.

verbs.look: Metal stall doors covered in layer upon layer of punk rock wisdom.
verbs.talk: The graffiti reads like a history of the Minneapolis scene.
verbs.use: You read the messages. Someone wrote your band name here once.

verbs.look: Fresh spray paint declares: 'MAYA WAS HERE' in electric pink.
verbs.talk: Maya's tag glows with neon defiance. She's alive somewhere in this chaos.
verbs.use: You trace the letters. Your bandmate left you a sign.

verbs.look: A grimy sink with rust stains trailing from the faucet like tears.
verbs.talk: The pipes groan with Minneapolis water pressure and decades of use.
verbs.use: You splash cold water on your face. Wake up. This is real.

verbs.look: An empty dispenser with one pathetic sheet hanging out.
verbs.talk: The dispenser rattles hollow. No comfort here.
verbs.use: You grab the last towel. It's something.

hotspots.name: Bathroom Door

verbs.look: A paint-chipped door marked with a faded 'WC' sign.
verbs.use: You head back into the club's chaos.
verbs.talk: The door muffles the bass thump from the main room.

hotspots.transition_message: The throb of music hits you like a wave as you exit.

rooms.name: The Record Vault
rooms.entry_message: Dust dances in shafts of light between floor-to-ceiling vinyl treasures.

verbs.look: Shelves packed with rare pressings: Prince demos, Husker Du live bootlegs.
verbs.talk: The records whisper Minneapolis music history in crackling grooves.
verbs.use: You flip through carefully. Each cover is a portal to 1982.

verbs.look: A locked case holds the crown jewel: an ultra-rare 'Zombie Minneapolis' pressing.
verbs.talk: The record glows golden under protective glass. Priceless.
verbs.use: The case won't budge. This treasure stays protected.

verbs.look: A rolling ladder for reaching top-shelf rarities.
verbs.talk: The ladder has witnessed countless vinyl hunts.
verbs.use: You climb up. The view from here is nothing but music.

verbs.look: A weathered crate filled with vinyl waiting to be sorted.
verbs.talk: Crate-digger zombies guard this collection jealously.
verbs.use: You dig through. Mostly common pressings, but the hunt thrills.

verbs.look: A vintage turntable ready to spin any treasure you find.
verbs.talk: The needle waits to translate grooves into magic.
verbs.use: You cue up a record. The vault fills with Minneapolis sound.

hotspots.name: Vault Door

verbs.look: A heavy door marked 'VAULT' in gold lettering.
verbs.use: You step out, ears still ringing with vinyl ghosts.
verbs.talk: The door guards musical history like a bank vault guards gold.

hotspots.transition_message: You emerge from the archives, carrying sonic memories.

rooms.name: The Promoter's Office
rooms.entry_message: Red carpet and gold records mask something darker lurking in the shadows.

verbs.look: An imposing desk covered in contracts, a rotary phone, and whiskey.
verbs.talk: The desk radiates power. How many careers were made and broken here?
verbs.use: You rifle through the papers. Standard contracts with... unusual clauses.

verbs.look: Stacks of band contracts with tiny print. Something feels off.
verbs.talk: The contracts promise fame but demand... your soul? Metaphorically?
verbs.use: You read the fine print. 'Eternal service to First Avenue.' Yikes.

verbs.look: Gold records line the wall: The Neon Dead, Soul Asylum, Husker Du.
verbs.talk: Each gold disc represents a soul... er, a successful album.
verbs.use: You examine them closely. They seem to glow with unnatural light.

verbs.look: Subtle pentagrams woven into the carpet pattern. Barely visible.
verbs.talk: The symbols pulse with dark energy. This explains everything.
verbs.use: You trace the pattern. The zombie outbreak started here, didn't it?

verbs.look: Business books mixed with occult volumes. 'Contracts with the Damned' stands out.
verbs.talk: The books speak of dark bargains and musical immortality.
verbs.use: You pull out a tome. Chapter 1: 'Raising the Dead for Fun and Profit.'

verbs.look: City lights twinkle below. Minneapolis glows like a circuit board.
verbs.talk: From up here, you can see the neon spreading like an infection.
verbs.use: You press your hand to the cold glass. The city needs saving.

verbs.look: The Promoter sits behind his massive desk, power suit gleaming. Gold chains catch the light as he shuffles contracts with a sinister smile.
verbs.talk: "Looking for stardom?" he purrs, sliding a contract across the desk. "Just sign on the dotted line. Everyone does, eventually."
verbs.use: You try to read the contract. The text seems to writhe and shift, revealing glimpses of occult symbols and binding clauses that freeze your blood.

hotspots.name: Private Door

verbs.look: A door marked 'PRIVATE' in blood-red letters.
verbs.use: You leave the villain's lair, plan forming in your mind.
verbs.talk: The door guards secrets darker than you imagined.

hotspots.transition_message: You descend from the office, knowledge weighing heavy.

rooms.name: The Loading Dock
rooms.entry_message: Zombie roadies shuffle equipment under sodium lights and a starlit sky.

verbs.look: A trailer emblazoned with 'THE NEON DEAD' tour logo. Ready to roll.
verbs.talk: The truck represents escape, freedom, the open road.
verbs.use: You climb into the cab. Keys are still in the ignition...

verbs.look: Flight cases stenciled with tour dates and city names. Well-traveled.
verbs.talk: Each case carries memories of stages played and crowds moved.
verbs.use: You pop one open. Cables, pedals, and a roadie's flask.

verbs.look: A raised platform where gear gets loaded and unloaded.
verbs.talk: This dock has seen more equipment than most stages.
verbs.use: You stand on the platform, surveying your kingdom.

verbs.look: A bright sodium lamp casting orange pools across the asphalt.
verbs.talk: The light keeps the darkness at bay. Barely.
verbs.use: You step into the glow. Temporary safety.

verbs.look: A zombie roadie clutches a coiled cable, forever loading in.
verbs.talk: The roadie moans the ancient song: 'One more trip to the truck.'
verbs.use: You pat the roadie's shoulder. Thanks for the dedication, pal.

verbs.look: A glowing green EXIT sign. Your way out of Minneapolis?
verbs.talk: The sign beckons. But can you really leave the city like this?
verbs.use: You memorize the route. Escape is always an option.

hotspots.name: Overhead Door

verbs.look: A rolling door leading back into the venue's depths.
verbs.use: You duck under the door, back into the musical labyrinth.
verbs.talk: The door groans on its track, mechanical and weary.

hotspots.transition_message: The night air fades as you re-enter the venue's electric maze.
